channel.title: Theme Demo on Siddharth Shashi

item.title: SpeakEasy
item.description:
Last fall at CalHacks, UC Berkeley’s 2,000+ participant hackathon, my team won 1st place for “Best Use of Language AI” with SpeakEasy, an AI companion that translates voices while preserving intonation. GitHub Repository

Overview Link to heading

Visiting another country but don’t want to sound like a robot? Want to learn a new language but can’t get your intonation to sound like other people’s? SpeakEasy can make you sound like, well, you!

item.title: PintOS
item.description:
PintOS is an educational operating system for the x86 CPU architecture which supports multithreading, loading and running user programs, and a file system. As part of our Operating Systems class, my team and I built PintOS over the course of a 5-month long semester. Unfortunately, because this was a project for a university course, I cannot post the code publicly.

Argument Passing Link to heading

First, we extended the barebones Pintos operating system to support argument passing and a robust set of system calls for process management and file operations. Initially, Pintos lacked the ability to handle command-line arguments, which caused many test programs to crash. We implemented argument passing, allowing user processes to correctly receive argc and argv, ensuring compatibility with standard command-line conventions.

item.title: Affordable 3D Scene Reconstruction
item.description: This article offers a sample of basic Markdown syntax that can be used in Hugo content files, also it shows whether basic HTML elements are decorated with CSS in a Hugo theme.
